    • Method Detail

      • fireTransition

        public void fireTransition(Transition transitionToFire)
                    throws IllegalTransitionFiringError,
                           PetriNetException
        Tries to fire a transition.
        • If fails, the calling thread sleeps in the corresponding transition's queue
        • If succeeds, it checks if there are new enabled transitions. If not it leaves, else it tries to fire some new enabled transition (which transition is to be fired is the policy's decision). This may lead into two situations:
          • The transition to fire is automatic, then just fire it
          • The transition to fire is not automatic but another thread was waiting to fire it. In that case, wake up that thread and leave the monitor
        For timed transitions, the calling thread sleeps until the transition reaches its time span, only then fires it. More info in project readme file.
        Parameters:
        transitionToFire - The transition to fire
        Throws:
        NotInitializedPetriNetException - when firing a timed transition before initializing the petri net
        IllegalTransitionFiringError - when an request to fire an automatic transition arrives
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding petri nets occurs.
        See Also:
        PetriNet.fire(Transition)

      • fireTransition

        public void fireTransition(Transition transitionToFire,
                           boolean notPerennialFire)
                    throws IllegalTransitionFiringError,
                           PetriNetException
        Tries to fire a transition.
        • If fails, the calling thread sleeps in the corresponding transition's queue
        • If succeeds, it checks if there are new enabled transitions. If not it leaves, else it tries to fire some new enabled transition (which transition is to be fired is the policy's decision). This may lead into two situations:
          • The transition to fire is automatic, then just fire it
          • The transition to fire is not automatic but another thread was waiting to fire it. In that case, wake up that thread and leave the monitor
        For timed transitions, the calling thread sleeps until the transition reaches its time span, only then fires it. A perennial fire sends a thread to sleep when the firing failed. More info in project readme file.
        Parameters:
        transitionToFire - The transition to fire
        notPerennialFire - False indicates a perennial fire
        Throws:
        IllegalTransitionFiringError - when an request to fire an automatic transition arrives
        NotInitializedPetriNetException - when firing a timed transition before initializing the petri net
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding petri nets occurs.
        See Also:
        PetriNet.fire(Transition)

      • fireTransition

        public void fireTransition(java.lang.String transitionName)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           IllegalTransitionFiringError,
                           PetriNetException
        Parameters:
        transitionName - The name of the transition to fire.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no transition matches transitionName
        IllegalTransitionFiringError - If transitionName matches an automatic transition
        NotInitializedPetriNetException - when firing a timed transition before initializing the petri net
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding petri nets occurs.
        See Also:
        fireTransition(Transition)

      • fireTransition

        public void fireTransition(java.lang.String transitionName,
                           boolean notPerennialFire)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           IllegalTransitionFiringError,
                           PetriNetException
        Parameters:
        transitionName - The name of the transition to fire.
        notPerennialFire - False indicates a perennial fire
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no transition matches transitionName
        IllegalTransitionFiringError - If transitionName matches an automatic transition
        NotInitializedPetriNetException - when firing a timed transition before initializing the petri net
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding petri nets occurs.
        See Also:
        fireTransition(Transition)

      • getQueuesState

        public boolean[] getQueuesState()
        Fills and returns a vector of booleans containing whether at least one thread is sleeping in the matching VarCondQueue
        Returns:
        a vector of boolean indicating if at least a thread is sleeping in each VarCondQueue

      • setTransitionsPolicy

        public void setTransitionsPolicy(TransitionsPolicy _transitionsPolicy)
        Changes the transitions policy at runtime. If null just ignores the new policy and keeps the previous
        Parameters:
        _transitionsPolicy - the new policy to be set

      • subscribeToTransition

        public rx.Subscription subscribeToTransition(java.lang.String _transitionName,
                                             rx.Observer<java.lang.String> _observer)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Subscribe the given observer to the transition matching the given name's events if it's informed
        Parameters:
        _transitionName - the name of the transition to subscribe to
        _observer - the observer to subscribe
        Returns:
        a Subscription object used to unsubscribe
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given transition is not informed, the name or observer is null or the name doesn't match any transition

      • subscribeToTransition

                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Subscribe the given observer to the given transition events if it's informed
        Parameters:
        _transition - the transition to subscribe to
        _observer - the observer to subscribe
        Returns:
        a Subscription object used to unsubscribe
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given transition is not informed or the transition or observer is null

      • isAnyThreadSleepingForTransition

        public boolean isAnyThreadSleepingForTransition(int transitionIndex)
        Check if a thread is sleeping (on its own, outside any queues) for the given transition.
        Parameters:
        transitionIndex - The index of the transition to check is a thread is sleeping for.
        Returns:
        True if a thread is sleeping for the given transition.
